MobileSheets is currently managing files in the storage location. All of these files must be moved to the new location, and the process may take awhile. If you do not want files to be moved, you must first disable the "Manage My Files" setting.

resources.string: Creating Snippet in Database, please wait…
No database backups are currently available.

Are you sure you want to completely replace your database? This action cannot be undone and may result in the loss of library content. Restoring a library backup is the preferred way to restore the database.
The database has been successfully restored.
Failed to restore the database backup. The original database has been restored.
Failed to restore the database backup. The original database could not be restored.

Welcome to MobileSheets! If this is your first time using the app, it is highly recommended that you read the online manual before getting started. There are a huge number of features in MobileSheets, and you will get much more out of the app if you know what is available. To read the manual, click the button below. To continue, tap OK or the back button.
Would you like MobileSheetsPro to copy and manage all imported files? This setting and the storage location for files can be changed at any time on the main settings screen.
An error was encountered downloading the latest manual. The last cached version will be used.
No cached version of the manual is available. You must connect to Wi-Fi to download the manual.
Load pre-populated email form for Zubersoft support.
View the recent changes to MobileSheets.
Use Large Letters For Alphabet List
Uses much larger letters on the right hand side of the library for jumping to songs starting with a given letter.
Places the alphabet list on the left side of the screen for left handed users
Changes the formatting of song titles to include the fields you want displayed.
Changes the formatting of song titles when generating a setlist song list.
Sets the name to be displayed for the custom category
Switches the library screen to use white text on a black background.
Provides alternating row colors to make it easier to distinguish individual entries on the library screen.
Determines how to align the text in the library screen lists.
Determines what tabs are shown and in what order.
Shows the number of songs next to the title of any library entry that contains a list of songs (i.e. Setlists/Collections/Artists)
Automatically clears the current filters if a song or setlist is loaded
Determines if the floating toolbar is displayed at the bottom right corner of the library screen
Determines if articles such as \'the\', \'an\', and \'a\' are ignored while grouping songs by letter.
Sets the list of articles that should be ignored. Values must be separated by commas.
Determines if diacritical marks are removed from characters while sorting and certain other characters are replaced, i.e. Č becomes C, Å becomes A, Ö becomes O
If selected, automatically loads the next song listed on the library screen when turning past the last page of the current song.
If set, when a song is clicked on the library screen, the last viewed page of the song will be loaded.
Select the tab that will first be shown when the application loads.
If selected, tapping on a song in a setlist will load the entire setlist and skip to the song. If not, just that one song is loaded.
Skip Viewing Groups with One Song

If a group with only one song is tapped, the song will be loaded instead of viewing the group. Empty groups will be shown with a gray title. If group song counts are enabled, no number is shown for groups with a single song.
Determines if, when zooming out, the document can be made smaller than the screen dimensions.
Disables the page turn animation, making pages turn instantly.
If enabled, skips back to the beginning of a song or setlist when a user advances past the last page, and skips to the end of a song if the users advances backwards from the first page.
Displays half a page when the tablet is in landscape orientation while using the single page display mode.
Advances half a page at a time while using the single page display mode in landscape orientation.
Separate Songs in Two Page Mode
Ensures that only one song will be visible at a time in the two page display.
Changes the rendered size of the link points. The default radius is 28.
The color that is used to fill empty space while viewing images/PDFs. Also acts as the background color for transparent images.
Inverts black and white to help in dark environments.
Ensures that if a page is vertically smaller than the tablet it will be centered in the middle of the viewable area.
Determines if the song titles shown in the overlay, setlist window and next up song bar will use the same formatting as the library screen.
Determines when a bar is shown at the top of the screen indicating what song is coming up next
Determines if the information bar is always visible at the top of the screen while viewing a song.
Enables/disables the mini-preview window that appears while using the page slider to change pages.
Determines what finger action brings up the overlay. A single tap always closes it.
Determines if the page slider is hidden, shown with the overlay, or always visible at the bottom of the screen while viewing a song.
Determines if pages should be rendered at maximum quality and accuracy or as fast as possible. If you have problems with PDFs loading too slowly, changing this setting may help.
If running HoneyComb or later, the navigation bar will be dimmed while viewing songs, otherwise this has no effect. It will not be dimmed on the library screen.
If this option is checked, the navigation bar will be completely hidden while viewing songs, requiring a swipe to show it. It will not be hidden on the library screen.
Enables fullscreen mode, which hides the Android notification bar at the top of the screen. This setting affects all screens.
Enables automatic conversion of PDF bookmarks to MobileSheets bookmarks during import. The PDF will not be modified.
Determines if matching audio files will be automatically added to songs when files are imported. The file names before the extensions must match.
Enables a more aggressive algorithm for removing margins which tries to ignore noise in the margins of pages.
Determines if song fields are populated using the metadata from imported audio files.
Select the actions that will occur when pedals are pressed.
Stops the pedal from changing songs, requiring a tap on the screen instead.
Select the actions that will occur when various parts of the screen are touched
Determines whether or not USB mouse clicks will be used to turn pages
Switches the mouse click actions so that a left mouse click turns back one page, and a right mouse click turns forward one page
Treat Mouse Click as Pedal Press
Treat every mouse click the same as if a left or right bluetooth pedal was pressed
The default settings to use when displaying text files. Default settings can be overriden for each file if needed.
Wraps text if it exceeds the width of the screen
Displays text in multiple columns on the screen if the content is narrow enough to fit.
Places chords above text instead of inline
Use Text Fields During Song Creation
If enabled, text fields in a file such as album and key will be used for song metadata during creation
If enabled, a song will be tranposed down when a capo is applied. If disabled, the song will be transposed up.
Determines if output directives such as the lyrics font name and size are processed.
Determines how the key of a text file is determined when it is first added to a song.
Displays a dropdown to switch a text file\'s encoding. Enable this if you see ? characters in your text files.
Automatically sizes the font for new text or chord pro files so that they take up as much of the screen width as possible, up to the font size specified in the \"Maximum Auto Font Size\" setting.
The maximum setting that will be used for automatically sizing font. This ensures files with short lines will not be made too large on the screen.
Sets the default MIDI channel on which MIDI commands will be sent and received.
Allows MIDI messages to be sent to multiple devices on different channels. Additional settings will be shown in the song editor.
Selects the type of MIDI keyboard or device. This allows vendor specific messages to be sent.
Controls when the screen is prevented from turning off due to inactivity.
Stops the CPU and other processing resources from sleeping. If you experience problems with a bluetooth pedal sleeping, turn on this setting. Note that this can cause battery drain.
Locates songs in the library that are missing files and optionally removes them
Are you sure you want to delete all of the songs shown in the list?
Unknown error occurred, unable to swap file. Try restarting the application. If this error persists, please contact Zubersoft

plurals.name: find_missing_files_title
plurals.item: %1$d songs found with %2$d total missing files

resources.string: No files are missing in the library.
Stops audio playback when returning to the library screen.
Determines if confirmation is required before exiting the app by hitting the back button.
Defaults to showing the number section of the keyboard first. For some tablets, they show numbers and letters together by default, so this setting has no effect.
Provides a converter to produce image files from a PDF.
Deletes your entire library, and optionally deletes song files.
Resets all user preferences to their default settings.
Are you sure you want to clear all user settings? This cannot be undone.
This will delete everything in your library. This action cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to clear your library?
Backup all songs and files to a msb file at a user specified location.
Replaces the current library with all songs and files from a selected .msb file.
This will completely replace your current library. This operation cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to restore backup file \"%1$s\"?
Allows one of the automatic database backups to be restored in the case that data has been lost. Restoring a database backup is irreversible, so be cautious when using this feature.

Determines if MobileSheets should make copies of all imported files and organize them in the MobileSheets storage location (as shown below). If you uncheck this option, MobileSheets will always use files in their original directories.
Sets the folder to use for files managed by MobileSheets. If you import from Dropbox, an email, or some other non-local source, your files will be copied into this directory.
Places the database file into the MobileSheets storage location instead of making it application private.
Deletes original files after MobileSheets has copied them to the storage location.
If enabled, a new folder will be created for every song to hold its files.
Determines whether or not MobileSheets will copy audio files into the storage location.
Adds a unique identifier to files when being imported to help reduce file name conflicts. Use this if you regularly import files with duplicate names.
Switches the active dropbox account for file imports.
Failed to write out data to file %1$s. Check to see if the SD card is full.
Failed to create file %1$s. Check to see if the SD card is full or the directory is read-only.
Failed to open and read text document: %1$s
Are you sure you want to clear the recent list?
Storing information for song. Please wait…
Unable to both load database or create a new one. Please try restarting MobileSheets. If this does not work, you may need to reinstall.
No database file is present on the tablet, but a backup was found. Would you like to load the backup (recommended)? Your library will be empty otherwise.
Unable to load required resource. The resource will be automatically downloaded if wifi is enabled and active.
Downloading PDF rendering library. Please wait…
Unable to download PDF rendering library. You will not be able to view PDFs until the library is downloaded.
The MobileSheetsPro installation appears to be corrupted or damaged. The PDF rendering library is missing or inaccessible. Please try reinstalling the application.
The PDF rendering library was successful download. The application will now be restarted.
Wifi does not appear to be enabled. An internet connection is required for the PDF library to be downloaded. Connect to a network and try again.
Only %1$d songs are allowed in your library until the license check succeeds.
No voice recognizer found on the device.
This device does not appear to support voice recognition. This functionality will be disabled.
Speak the name of the entry to find in the current list
Wifi does not appear to be enabled. You cannot connect to a pc without it.
You do not appear to be connected to a wireless network. Please connect and try again.

Links cannot be created between two different songs.

Unable to add file. If problem persists, try using a different file manager.

The backup has failed to complete due to the following:

You must select a valid PDF file before converting.

Failed to convert desired height to integer. Defaulting to PDF size for image height.\n
Failed to open PDF file due to error: %1$s
Failed to add new bookmark. This may indicate a problem with the database.
Failed to update bookmark. This may indicate a problem with the database.

Unable to read backup file %1$s. Reported error - %2$s
Unable to read file from %3$s: %1$s. Reported error - %2$s

The database in the backup file is corrupted, and cannot be used. You will need to restore a different backup.
Invalid file selected. Only valid MobileSheets Backup Files with a .msb extension are allowed.
Library restore is not allowed without a licensed version.
Restoring Library - DO NOT CANCEL OR DISCONNECT FROM THE NETWORK
Initiating Restore, this may take awhile…
You are the middle of restoring your library. Are you sure you want to cancel? Songs that have not been restored may not be able to load correctly if you proceed.

\n\nYour library may no longer work correctly.
The restore has failed to complete due to an out of memory error on the tablet. Please report this to support@zubersoft.com.
The selected backup file is not a valid MobileSheets backup file.
Error in backup file. Trying to skip bad data…

Restore completed successfully. Some files could not be written to disk due to invalid or incompatible paths, or an error in the database. This may be because some files were not accessible (SD card not inserted?). Using a backup file from a different tablet may also cause this.
The free version of MobileSheets only allows a maximum of %1$d songs in your library. Would you like to go to the market to upgrade to the paid version?

resources.string: Unable to load page %1$d for file %2$s

The grace period for the app has ended and the license check has failed. Please establish a wifi connection to authorize use of this app. If you have already paid for this app, click Send Email to provide information about your device for an alternative license check model. Please allow 24 hours for Zubersoft to process the request.

Order #: (You must supply this)

My license check has failed. Please add my device to the exception list.

SlideME Transaction ID #: (You must supply this)

My license check has failed. Please add my device to the exception list.
License check failed. A grace period of 72 HOURS is in effect before access will not be allowed. You must get wifi access to pass the license check.
Your license is still not verified. You have %1$d hours left before you will not be able to load MobileSheets. Please obtain a wifi connection and reload MobileSheets to pass the license check.

Your license is still not verified. You have less than one hour left before you will not be able to load MobileSheets. Please obtain a wifi connection and reload MobileSheets to pass the license check.
This application has encountered an error while checking the license. Please contact support at http://www.zubersoft.com/mobilesheets/support.html
In order to connect using USB, USB Debugging must first be enabled. Go to the companion app menu and click Help -> How to Enable USB Debugging for more information.
Do Not Turn Off The Screen!
Unable to connect to host pc. Do you want to try to reconnect?
The version of the companion app is out of date. At least version %1$s is required.
PC has requested deletion of %1$d files
Unable to process delete images message due to connection error
Unable to process delete images messages due to tablet reporting out of memory error.
Unable to read data for song deletion message from PC
Failed to retrieve requested song while deleting files.
PC has requested the deletion of song: %1$s
Unable to process delete images message: %1$s
Error sending tablet app version to PC due to connection problem.
Error sending tablet app version to PC: %1$s
MobileSheetsCompanion is running version %1$d. This is compatible.
MobileSheetsCompanion is running version %1$d. This is incompatible with this version.
Connection error while receiving PC version: %1$s

Waiting for user to establish connection through MobileSheets Companion pop up window. If no window pops up, please exit MobileSheets, turn your tablet wifi off, then back on, and restart MobileSheets.
Connection from PC accepted, sending acknowledgement.
Ending connection, freeing resources, and sending disconnect message to PC
Error: invalid message received from PC. Ignoring message.
Connection error, waiting for retry confirmation…
The backup has failed to complete due to an error.
Backup request received from PC, starting transfer.
This copy is not licensed. Backups are not allowed until the license check succeeds.
Stopping library backup and sending cancellation acknowledgement

Song has no files listed. This is not currently valid.

Error receiving audio tracks from PC.

resources.string: Are you sure you want to write the annotations to file \'%1$s\'? This will remove the annotations from MobileSheetsPro and you will not be able to edit them.
Are you sure you want to write the annotations to file? This will convert \'%1$s\' to PDF and you will no longer be able to edit the song\'s annotations.
Delete original files after conversion (if not PDFs)
Replace file with custom page order
Warning: Multiple pages in the current page order refer to the same page in the file. Annotations will be combined on the same page.
An error was encountered while exporting annotations. Try restarting MobileSheetsPro and then try again. If this problem persists, please contact support@zubersoft.com
